column3: Name: “Table 1 of 1 on page 106 of 124”
Table: 98
Capital Improvement Plan
DESCRIPTION
Replacement of laundry equipment for the Hampton
Community Corrections Facilities (inmate uniforms only). The
current equipment, which was installed in 1998, is at the end
of its useful life. Constant repair is required due to the daily
usage and the equipment is now at a point of severe
deterioration.
Funding for future projects for compliance with the City's
stormwater permit. Negotiations are underway with the
Virginia Department of Conservation and Recreation and the
Environmental Protection Agency on the new permit
requirements. It is expected that funds will be needed to
begin retrofitting existing developed areas of the City to
reduce stormwater pollutions
TOTAL: Other CIP Projects
Complete Phase II of Old North Hampton Neighborhood curb
and gutter program.
Add amenities to the stormwater wet pond within the
interchange.
Continue landscaping and lighting treatment east of the
Coliseum in the area from Coliseum Drive to Aberdeen Road,
to include installation mission sections of sidewalks, street
trees in the medians or in the merge area and adding more
decorative and pedestrian level lighting.
Construct pedestrian walkways along both sides of Mercury
Boulevard between Coliseum Drive and Armistead Avenue
including pedestrian crossing signals and additional
pedestrian level lighting.
Construct a stair, ADA accessible connection and amenities
between Pine Chapel Road and the trail around the Power
Plant lake.
TOTAL: Outside Agencies
